summary: This is an email exchange from October 28, 2020, between prosecutors in the United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell case and potential expert witness Dr. Kimberly Mehlman-Orozco. The prosecutors inquire about her availability to testify at the trial scheduled for July 12, 2020, and discuss scheduling a call.

persons.name: Kimberly Mehlman-Orozco
persons.context: Addressed as Dr. Mehlman-Orozco, she is being contacted by prosecutors to discuss her availability to testify at the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, scheduled for trial.

connections.description: Prosecutors are contacting Mehlman-Orozco to potentially testify as an expert witness in the criminal trial against Maxwell.

events.title: Scheduled Trial Date for United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The trial for the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell was scheduled to begin on this date in the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Prosecutors Contact Potential Expert Witness
events.description: Prosecutors from the Southern District of New York emailed Dr. Kimberly Mehlman-Orozco to discuss her potential testimony as an expert witness in the Maxwell trial.

keyFacts: Prosecutors in the Ghislaine Maxwell case were actively seeking expert witnesses as of October 2020 for a trial scheduled for July 2020.
The correspondence shows the prosecution's trial preparation efforts, specifically in lining up expert testimony.
The email identifies Kimberly Mehlman-Orozco as a potential expert witness for the government.
The document is a direct communication between the U.S. Attorney's Office and a prospective witness.
